pageProps.contentHtml:
Lp spaces

Let K⊆RK \subseteq \RK⊆R be a compact set of positive measure and let f∈L∞(R)f \in L^\infty\p{\R}f∈L∞(R). Show that the function

F(x)=1∣K∣∫Kf(x+t) dtF\p{x} = \frac{1}{\abs{K}} \int_K f\p{x + t} \,\diff{t}F(x)=∣K∣1​∫K​f(x+t)dt

is uniformly continuous on R\RR. Here ∣K∣\abs{K}∣K∣ denotes the Lebesgue measure of KKK.
Solution.

By the change of variables t↦x+tt \mapsto x + tt↦x+t, we can write

F(x)=1m(K)∫x+Kf(t) dt=1m(K)∫Rf(t)χx+K(t) dt=1m(K)∫Rf(t)χK(t−x) dt.F\p{x} = \frac{1}{m\p{K}} \int_{x + K} f\p{t} \,\diff{t} = \frac{1}{m\p{K}} \int_\R f\p{t}\chi_{x + K}\p{t} \,\diff{t} = \frac{1}{m\p{K}} \int_\R f\p{t}\chi_K\p{t - x} \,\diff{t}.F(x)=m(K)1​∫x+K​f(t)dt=m(K)1​∫R​f(t)χx+K​(t)dt=m(K)1​∫R​f(t)χK​(t−x)dt.

Fix ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. Then given x,y∈Rx, y \in \Rx,y∈R,

∣F(x)−F(y)∣≤1m(K)∫R∣f(t)∣∣χK(t−x)−χK(t−y)∣ dt=∥f∥L∞m(K)∫R∣χK(t)−χK(t+(x−y))∣ dt(t↦t−x)=∥f∥L∞m(K)∥χK−τx−yχK∥L1,\begin{aligned} \abs{F\p{x} - F\p{y}} &\leq \frac{1}{m\p{K}} \int_\R \abs{f\p{t}}\abs{\chi_K\p{t - x} - \chi_K\p{t - y}} \,\diff{t} \\ &= \frac{\norm{f}_{L^\infty}}{m\p{K}} \int_\R \abs{\chi_K\p{t} - \chi_K\p{t + \p{x - y}}} \,\diff{t} && (t \mapsto t - x) \\ &= \frac{\norm{f}_{L^\infty}}{m\p{K}} \norm{\chi_K - \tau_{x-y}\chi_K}_{L^1}, \end{aligned}∣F(x)−F(y)∣​≤m(K)1​∫R​∣f(t)∣∣χK​(t−x)−χK​(t−y)∣dt=m(K)∥f∥L∞​​∫R​∣χK​(t)−χK​(t+(x−y))∣dt=m(K)∥f∥L∞​​∥χK​−τx−y​χK​∥L1​,​​(t↦t−x)​

where τx−yg(t)=g(t+(x−y))\tau_{x-y}g\p{t} = g\p{t + \p{x-y}}τx−y​g(t)=g(t+(x−y)) in the translation operator. However, we know that translation is continuous in L1L^1L1, so there exists δ>0\delta > 0δ>0 such that if ∣x−y∣<δ\abs{x - y} < \delta∣x−y∣<δ, then ∥χK−τx−yχK∥L1<ε\norm{\chi_K - \tau_{x-y}\chi_K}_{L^1} < \epsilon∥χK​−τx−y​χK​∥L1​<ε. This only depends on ∣x−y∣\abs{x - y}∣x−y∣ and not xxx and yyy themselves, and so FFF is uniformly continuous on R\RR.
